name: Natasha Murashev
bio: Natasha is an iOS developer by day and a robot by night. She organizes the try! Swift Conference around the world (including this one!). She's currently living the digital nomad life as her alter identity: @NatashaTheNomad.

name: Daiki Matsudate
bio:
Daiki has worked as an iOS Developer for over 10 years and met as a volunteer staff member at try! Swift Tokyo in 2017. Inspired by the international speakers and sponsors he met then, he attended his first international conference, WWDC 2017.
In his work, I work as a software engineer at a ministry, while also serving as a technical advisor at various startups and listed companies, and as a general incorporated association try! Swift Tokyo.
When he is not working, he likes to take podcasts with friends, play RPG games, snowboard in the snowy mountains, and spend time with friends in the neighborhood.

name: Yutaro Muta
bio:
Yutaro is a Software Engineer who loves Swift. He has been contributing to try! Swift Tokyo since 2017.
Currently, he lives in the Kansai region and works at Hatena Co., Ltd.
His favorite things are beerüç∫ and sakeüç∂. Recently, he has been experimenting with the Apple Vision Pro.

name: Miharu Naruse
bio:
Miharu is an iOS Developer. After graduating from the faculty of agriculture at university, she somehow started developing iOS apps.
Her hobby is watching old movies. This year, she wants to learn English and go on a trip abroad!

name: Naoki Muramoto
bio:
Naoki is a 3rd year software engineer working in Tokyo who loves Swift.
He loves beer and often drinks it when he's not working.

name: Yoichiro Sakurai
bio: Yoichiro is an engineer who likes to solve interesting problems. I has been contributing to try! Swift Tokyo since 2017. I love gourmet food and drinks, especially Japanese sake!

name: Roku / Miki Yoshida
bio:
Roku is an iOS Developer. She  joined try! Swift in 2019 as a volunteer staff member, and became an organizer in 2020.
She loves Swift community and occasionally organizes study sessions and development camps.
She is interested in beer, whiskey, and unique design clothes. In addition to creating apps, She also enjoy making accessories.
Her lucky number is 6Ô∏è‚É£, which is called "Roku" in Japanese.
